EN: What are the most common themes in Switzerland's federal ballots?
PT: Quais os temas mais comuns nas votações federais da Suíça?

EN: Top 50 keyword themes assigned to all federal ballots in Switzerland since 1848. Word size is scaled according to frequency. Hover over a term to see its count.
PT: Os 50 temas mais importantes presentes em todas as votações nacionais na Suíça desde 1848. O tamanho das letras corresponde à frequência com que o tema aparece ao longo da história. Passe o cursor sobre cada termo para ver sua contagem.

EN: What is Switzerland's direct democracy about?
PT: Do que se trata a democracia direta suíça?

EN: National ballots in Switzerland from 1848 until 2016, for selected themes and by 10 years brackets.
a referendum (mandatory or optional) with a majority 'no' vote
a referendum with a majority 'yes' vote

JA: イニシアチブ（国民発議）
強制的レファレンダム
任意のレファレンダム

EN:
Environment has been a big theme in Swiss ballots over the last 40 years.

Note the different people's initiatives which were accepted.

Lately, the Swiss have been nearly as concerned with the environment as with the rising immigrant population.

Note the two people's initiatives accepted by Swiss citizens since 2010.

Women's suffrage at the federal level was introduced only in 1971 with a mandatory referendum.

It was a prevalent theme since, although not all ballots here are about women's emancipation. For instance, the Swiss voted multiple times regarding abortion.

A consistent popular theme in Swiss ballots.

But not all votes were to increase fundamental rights, for instance the last two people's initiatives accepted were to limit foreigners' rights.

Faced with an ageing population, there have been numerous votes on pensions over the last 20 years.

With not much success, all people's initiatives regarding pensions have been rejected.
Through people's initiatives, there have many unsuccessful attempts to change how to tax goods and services.
Given its federalism, Switzerland regularly voted on the cantonal-country interplay.
Not much interest for children or the young in the polls until recently.
The weapon trade has regularly come under the scrutiny of people's initiatives
Food self-sufficiency used to be a thing.
The Swiss like polls so much, they regularly voted on how to modifiy their direct democracy or electoral system.
